page.title: 14Playden School 40 Years Ago
page.content: Our school was built on a pond which was found when the floor was rebuilt. It now has 3 classrooms but used to have 2. The infant classroom was added later and was built over the school's vegetable patch. They used to get all their water from an outside tank which was filled up each week. In front of the teacher's desk was a rope. The headmaster just had to lean forward and pull the rope to ring the bell that was on the roof. There were 2 cloakrooms, both very small. One is now the headmaster's office. The first outing the school's upper juniors went on was to Canterbury. They came out of the Cathedral and asked the Archbishop if he would have a photo taken with the juniors, so he did.
